means: 聘用( hire的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Bruce Springsteen has re-hired his muso collective, the E Street Band.
sentence.Network_cn: 布鲁斯·斯普林斯汀重新组建了他的音乐团队，E街乐队。

sentence.Network_en: Sixteen of the contestants have hired lawyers and are suing the organisers.
sentence.Network_cn: 有16名参赛者已经请了律师，正在起诉主办方。

sentence.Network_en: Somebody hired from another country is not likely to resign precipitately.
sentence.Network_cn: 外国雇员不可能贸然辞职。

entry.def: If you hire someone, you employ them or pay them to do a particular job for you.

example.ex: Sixteen of the contestants have hired lawyers and are suing the organisers...
example.tran: 有16名参赛者已经请了律师，正在起诉主办方。

example.ex: The rest of the staff have been hired on short-term contracts...
example.tran: 其余的工作人员签的是短期雇用合同。

entry.def: If you hire something, you pay money to the owner so that you can use it for a period of time.

example.ex: To hire a car you must produce a passport and a current driving licence...
example.tran: 租车须出示护照及有效驾照。

example.ex: Her hired car was found abandoned at Beachy Head.
example.tran: 她那辆租来的车被发现遗弃在比奇角。

entry.def: You use hire to refer to the activity or business of hiring something.

example.ex: They booked our hotel, and organised car hire...
example.tran: 他们为我们订好了旅馆并安排了租车事宜。

example.ex: Hire of skis, boots and clothing, is all available.
example.tran: 滑雪板、滑雪靴和滑雪服皆有出租。

entry.def: If something is for hire, it is available for you to hire.

example.ex: Fishing tackle is available for hire.

means.word_mean: 1. having services engaged for a fee;
2. hired for the exclusive temporary use of a group of travelers;

auth_sentence.content: I've hired many people at very strange places.

Sentence.sentence: Have you hired any employees to work with you yet?
Four million people get hired every month in the U
And as it turns out, even today — with job growth near zero — over 4 million job hunters are being hired every month.
Standford University has hired a student-run company to design applications like a campus map and directory for the iPhone.
Two employees the Chris hired were stealing, and he had to fire them.
